messages.content: You are a tool that generates recipes. You are given the fields:{"pantry" : {"expiring_soon" : [items], "items" : [items]}, "recipe_type" : type of recipe to be generated, "supplies" : [kitchen supplies available], "use_only_pantry_items" : tells if you can use only pantry items}, items that are expiring soon must be used, provide the fields: recipe_name : name of the generated recipe, ingredients : dict where key = ingredient name, and the value = amount needed for the recipe, instructions : list of instructions on how to make the recipe

{"pantry" : {"expiring_soon" : ["vegan soygurt", "apples"],"items" : ["peanut butter", "orzo", "cashews", "oats", "bananas", "salsa", "muesli", "milk", "mince meat", "salad"]},"recipe_type" : "vegan breakfast","supplies" : ["skillet, basic kitchen supplies", "pressure cooker", "blender"],"use_only_pantry_items" : true}

{"recipe_name": "Vegan Apple and Soy Yogurt Breakfast Bowl","ingredients": [{"vegan soygurt": "150g"},{"apples": "1, diced"},{"oats": "100g"},{"peanut butter": "2 tbsp"},{"cashews": "30g, chopped"},{"banana": "1, sliced"},{"muesli": "50g"}],"instructions": ["1. In a bowl, mix the oats with enough soygurt to cover them. Let them soak for 10 minutes.","2. Dice the apple and slice the banana.","3. In a blender, blend half of the diced apple with peanut butter to create a smooth sauce.","4. To the oat mixture, add the remaining diced apple, sliced banana, chopped cashews, and muesli. Stir to combine.","5. Drizzle the apple and peanut butter sauce over the top of the bowl.","6. Serve immediately as a nourishing vegan breakfast bowl."]}

You are a tool that generates recipes. You are given the fields:{"pantry" : {"expiring_soon" : [items], "items" : [items]}, "recipe_type" : type of recipe to be generated, "supplies" : [kitchen supplies available], "use_only_pantry_items" : tells if you can use only pantry items}, items that are expiring soon must be used, provide the fields: recipe_name : name of the generated recipe, ingredients : dict where key = ingredient name, and the value = amount needed for the recipe, instructions : list of instructions on how to make the recipe

{"pantry" : {"expiring_soon" : ["bell peppers", "mince meat"],"items" : ["peanut butter", "macaroni", "curry powder", "cheese", "flour", "tomatoes", "potatoes", "milk"]},"recipe_type" : "finnish homefood","supplies" : ["skillet, basic kitchen supplies", "pressure cooker"],"use_only_pantry_items" : false}

{"recipe_name": "Finnish Style Minced Meat and Bell Pepper Macaroni Casserole","ingredients": [{"bell peppers": "2, chopped"},{"mince meat": "400g"},{"macaroni": "200g"},{"cheese": "150g, grated"},{"flour": "2 tbs"},{"tomatoes": "3, chopped"},{"potatoes": "2, diced"},{"milk": "200 ml"},{"curry powder": "1 tsp"},{"vegetable oil": "2 tbsp"},{"salt": "to taste"},{"black pepper": "to taste"}],"instructions": ["1. Preheat oven to 180°C.","2. Boil macaroni in salted water until al dente, then drain.","3. In a skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add mince meat, cook until browned.","4. Add chopped bell peppers, tomatoes, and diced potatoes to the skillet. Cook for 5 minutes.","5. Stir in curry powder, salt, and black pepper.","6. In a separate pan, make a roux by mixing flour with a little milk. Gradually add the rest of the milk, stirring continuously to make a smooth sauce.","7. Combine the cooked macaroni, meat and vegetable mixture, and the white sauce. Pour into a baking dish.","8. Top with grated cheese and bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes until the top is golden and bubbly.","9. Serve hot, ideally with a side of salad or crusty bread."]}

{"pantry" : {"expiring_soon" : [],"items" : ["peanut butter", "orzo", "cashews", "cherry tomatoes", "italian spice mix", "frozen green peas", "vegetable buillon cube", "walnuts", "olive oil", "fresh basil"]},"recipe_type" : "vegan","supplies" : ["skillet, basic kitchen supplies", "blender"],"use_only_pantry_items" : true}

{"recipe_name": "Vegan Orzo with Cherry Tomatoes and Green Peas","ingredients": [{"orzo": "200g"},{"cherry tomatoes": "150g, halved"},{"frozen green peas": "100g"},{"vegetable bouillon cube": "1"},{"olive oil": "2 tbs"},{"italian spice mix": "1 tsp"},{"cashews": "50g"},{"walnuts": "30g, crushed"},{"fresh basil": "handful chopped"},{"water": "500 ml"}],"instructions": ["1. In a skillet, heat 1 tbsp of olive oil over medium heat. Add the orzo and toast lightly for 2-3 minutes.","2. Dissolve the vegetable bouillon cube in 500 ml of hot water to make a broth.","3. Add the broth to the skillet with orzo, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.","4. Stir in the frozen green peas, cherry tomatoes, and Italian spice mix. Cook for another 5 minutes, or until the orzo is tender.","5. In a blender, blend cashews with a little water to make a creamy sauce.","6. Stir the cashew cream into the orzo mixture. Adjust seasoning as needed.","7. Serve hot, garnished with crushed walnuts and fresh basil."]}

{"pantry" : {"expiring_soon" : ["mangoes", "cucumber"],"items" : ["peanut butter", "rice paper", "rice vermicilli", "shrimp", "fish sauce", "spriracha", "tofu", "soy sauce", "salmon", "salad"]},"recipe_type" : "vietnamese","supplies" : ["skillet, basic kitchen supplies"],"use_only_pantry_items" : true}

{"recipe_name": "Vietnamese Mango and Cucumber Spring Rolls with Shrimp","ingredients": [{"mangoes": "2, thinly sliced"},{"cucumber": "1, julienned"},{"peanut butter": "2 tbsp"},{"rice paper": "8 sheets"},{"rice vermicelli": "200g"},{"shrimp": "200g, peeled and cooked"},{"fish sauce": "1 tbs"},{"sriracha": "1 tsp"},{"fish sauce": "1 tbsp"},{"tofu": "100g, thinly sliced"}],"instructions": ["1. Cook the rice vermicelli according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.","2. Prepare a dipping sauce by mixing peanut butter, fish sauce, soy sauce, and sriracha with a little water to get the desired consistency.","3. Soak a sheet of rice paper in warm water for a few seconds until soft, then lay it flat on a clean surface.","4. On the rice paper, place a small amount of rice vermicelli, a couple of shrimp, slices of mango, cucumber and tofu.","5. Roll the rice paper tightly around the filling, folding in the sides as you roll.","6. Repeat where remaining ingredients until all the spring rolls are made.","7. Serve the spring rolls where dipping sauce."]}

{"pantry" : {"expiring_soon" : ["kanasuikaleet"],"items" : ["pasta", "cherry tomatoes", "jasmiini riisiä", "ruokakermaa", "herneitä", "crushed tomatoes", "butter", "eggs", "mince meat", "soy sauce"]},"recipe_type" : "fast meal","supplies" : ["skillet, basic kitchen supplies", "pressure cooker", "microwave"],"use_only_pantry_items" : true}

{"recipe_name": "Creamy Mince and Chicken Strips Pasta","ingredients": [{"Chicken Strips (kanasuikaleet)": "200g"},{"Pasta": "250g"},{"Cherry Tomatoes": "100g"},{"Cooking Cream (ruokakermaa)": "200ml"},{"Peas (herneitä)": "100g"},{"Crushed Tomatoes": "150g"},{"butter": "2 tbsp"},{"Mince Meat": "200g"},{"Soy Sauce": "1 tbsp"}],"instructions": ["1. Cook pasta in boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside.","2. In a skillet, heat butter over medium heat and cook mince meat until browned.","3. Add the chicken strips and stir until cooked through.","4. Mix in cherry tomatoes, peas, crushed tomatoes, and soy sauce. Cook for 5 minutes.","5. Pour in cooking cream and simmer for an additional 5 minutes.","6. Combine the sauce where cooked pasta. Mix well.","7. Serve hot and enjoy your fast and delicious meal."]}

{"pantry" : {"expiring_soon" : ["Rye bread", "apples"],"items" : ["curry roux", "potatoes", "rice", "soy strips", "bananas", "kidney beans", "onions", "garlic", "ginger", "carrots"]},"recipe_type" : "vegan dinner","supplies" : ["skillet, basic kitchen supplies", "pressure cooker", "blender"],"use_only_pantry_items" : true}

{"recipe_name": "Vegan Curry with Soy Strips","ingredients": [{"Rye Bread": "4 slices"},{"apples": "1, grated"},{"Curry Roux": "100g"},{"Potatoes": "2 medium"},{"Rice": "200g"},{"Soy Strips": "150g"},{"Kidney Beans": "100g"},{"Onions": "1 large"},{"Garlic": "2 cloves"},{"Ginger": "3cm piece"},{"Carrots": "2 medium"}],"instructions": ["1. Cook rice according to package instructions.","2. In a skillet, sauté chopped onions, garlic, and ginger until onions are translucent.","3. Add diced potatoes, carrots, and soy strips. Cook for 5 minutes.","4. Add the grated apple and cook for another 2 minutes.","5. Mix in curry roux and add enough water to cover the ingredients. Simmer until the vegetables are tender.","6. Add kidney beans and cook for an additional 3 minutes.","7. Toast rye bread slices.","8. Serve the curry over rice with a side of toasted rye bread."]}

{"pantry" : {"expiring_soon" : ["vegan pepperoni"],"items" : ["pizza flour", "dry yeast", "vegan cheese", "pizza sauce", "vegan mayo", "spriracha", "mushrooms", "milk", "mince meat", "pineapple"]},"recipe_type" : "vegan","supplies" : ["skillet, basic kitchen supplies", "oven", "pizza stone"],"use_only_pantry_items" : true}

{"recipe_name": "Vegan Pepperoni and Pineapple Pizza","ingredients": [{"Vegan Pepperoni": "100g"},{"Pizza Flour": "400g"},{"Dry Yeast": "7g"},{"Vegan Cheese": "200g"},{"Pizza Sauce": "150g"},{"Vegan Mayo": "2 tbsp"},{"Sriracha": "1 tbsp"},{"Mushrooms": "100g, sliced"},{"Water": "250ml (for dough)"},{"Pineapple": "100g, diced"}],"instructions": ["1. Preheat oven where pizza stone inside to 250°C.","2. Mix pizza flour, dry yeast, and 42°C water to form a dough. Knead until smooth.","3. Let the dough rise in a warm place until doubled in size.","4. Roll out the dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.","5. Spread pizza sauce over the dough. Top with vegan cheese, vegan pepperoni, sliced mushrooms, and diced pineapple.","6. Mix vegan mayo with sriracha and drizzle over the pizza.","7. Transfer the pizza to the preheated pizza stone in the oven.","8. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until crust is golden and toppings are cooked.","9. Remove from oven, let it cool for a few minutes, then slice and serve."]}

{"pantry" : {"expiring_soon" : ["spinach"],"items" : ["peanut butter", "macaroni", "cashews", "crushed tomatoes", "tofu", "soy grounds", "bell pepper", "rice", "mince meat", "vegetable oil"]},"recipe_type" : "vegan","supplies" : ["skillet, basic kitchen supplies", "pressure cooker", "blender"],"use_only_pantry_items" : false}

{"recipe_name": "Vegan Spinach and Tofu Skillet","ingredients": [{"Spinach": "200g"},{"Crushed Tomatoes": "200g"},{"Tofu": "400g"},{"Vegetable Oil": "2 tbsp"},{"Bell Pepper": "1 medium"},{"Garlic": "2 cloves"},{"Onion": "1 medium"},{"Salt": "to taste"},{"Black Pepper": "to taste"}],"instructions": ["1. Dice the onion and bell pepper, and mince the garlic.","2. Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat.","3. Add the onion and garlic to the skillet and sauté until translucent.","4. Crumble the tofu into the skillet and cook until lightly browned.","5. Add the bell pepper and cook for an additional 3-5 minutes.","6. Stir in the spinach and crushed tomatoes, and cook until the spinach is wilted.","7. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.","8. Serve warm, optionally with rice or bread."]}

{"pantry" : {"expiring_soon" : ["salmon"],"items" : ["potatoes", "dill", "carrots", "onions", "garlic", "tomatoes", "butter", "spinach", "black pepper", "salt"]},"recipe_type" : "dinner","supplies" : ["skillet, basic kitchen supplies", "pressure cooker", "blender"],"use_only_pantry_items" : false}

{"recipe_name": "Pan-Seared Salmon with Garlic Butter Vegetables","ingredients": [{"Salmon": "2 fillets"},{"Potatoes": "4 medium"},{"Dill": "1 tbsp, chopped"},{"Carrots": "2 medium"},{"Onions": "1 medium"},{"Garlic": "3 cloves"},{"Tomatoes": "2 medium"},{"Butter": "50g"},{"Spinach": "150g"},{"Black Pepper": "to taste"},{"Salt": "to taste"},{"Olive Oil": "2 tbsp"},{"Lemon": "1"}],"instructions": ["1. Preheat the skillet over medium-high heat with olive oil.","2. Season the salmon with salt, black pepper, and lemon juice.","3. Place the salmon in the skillet, skin-side down, and cook for 4 minutes. Flip and cook for another 3 minutes. Set aside."," 4. Boil the potatoes until tender, then slice them.","5. In the same skillet, add butter, diced onions, and minced garlic. Cook until the onions are soft.","6. Add sliced carrots, diced tomatoes, and cook for 5 minutes.","7. Stir in the spinach, cooked potatoes, and dill. Cook until the spinach is wilted.","8. Season the vegetables with salt and black pepper.","9. Serve the vegetables alongside the pan-seared salmon."]}

{"pantry" : {"expiring_soon" : ["Bilberries", "Lingonberries"],"items" : ["peanut butter", "flour", "oil", "chicken", "bananas", "sugar", "green beans", "milk", "eggs", "butter"]},"recipe_type" : "dessert","supplies" : ["skillet, basic kitchen supplies", "oven", "blender"],"use_only_pantry_items" : false}

{"recipe_name": "Bilberry and Lingonberry Tart","ingredients": [{"Bilberries": "150g"},{"Lingonberries": "150g"},{"Flour": "200g"},{"Sugar": "150g"},{"Butter": "100g"},{"Eggs": "2"},{"Milk": "100ml"},{"Vanilla Extract": "1 tsp"},{"Lemon Zest": "1 tsp"}],"instructions": ["1. Preheat the oven to 180°C.","2. In a bowl, mix together flour, 50g sugar, and lemon zest.","3. Add cold butter, and mix until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.","4. In another bowl, whisk together 1 egg and milk. Combine where flour mixture to form a dough.","5. Press the dough into a tart pan and refrigerate for 30 minutes.","6. In a blender, puree half of the bilberries and lingonberries with 50g sugar.","7. Spread the berry puree over the tart base.","8. Top where remaining whole bilberries and lingonberries.","9. Beat the remaining egg with 50g sugar and vanilla extract. Pour over the berries.","10. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until set and golden.","11. Let cool before serving."]}
